adapt.parameter_based.RegularTransferLR¶

class adapt.parameter_based.RegularTransferLR(get_estimator=None, lambdap=1.0, intercept=True, fit_source=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Regular Transfer with Linear Regression

RegularTransferLR is a parameter-based domain adaptation method.

The method is based on the assumption that a good target estimator can be obtained by adapting the parameters of a pre-trained source estimator using a few labeled target data.

The approach consist in fitting a linear estimator on target data according to an objective function regularized by the euclidean distance between source and target parameters:

\[\beta_T = \underset{\beta \in \mathbb{R}^p}{\text{argmin}} \, ||X_T\beta - y_T||^2 + \lambda ||\beta - \beta_S||^2\]

Where:

  • \(\beta_T\) are the target model parameters.

  • \(\beta_S = \underset{\beta \in \mathbb{R}^p}{\text{argmin}} \, ||X_S\beta - y_S||^2\) are the source model parameters.

  • \((X_S, y_S), (X_T, y_T)\) are respectively the source and the target labeled data.

  • \(p\) is the number of features in \(X_T\) (\(+1\) if intercept is True).

  • \(\lambda\) is a trade-off parameter.

Parameters
get_estimatorcallable or object, optional (default=None)

Constructor for the source estimator. The estimator returned by get_estimator should belong to one of these two scikit-learn class: LinearRegression or Ridge. If get_estimator is None, a LinearRegression object will be used by default as estimator.

lambdapfloat, optional (default=1.0)

Trade-Off parameter.

interceptboolean, optional (default=True)

If True, use intercept for target estimator

fit_sourceboolean, optional (default=True)

If fit_source is set to True, the estimator returned by get_estimator will be fitted on source data. If False, the source estimator will be considered already fitted and no preliminary training on source data will be done.

kwargskey, value arguments, optional

Additional arguments for get_estimator.

See also

RegularTransferLC, RegularTransferNN

References

1

[1] C. Chelba and A. Acero. “Adaptation of maximum entropy classifier: Little data can help a lot”. In EMNLP, 2004.

Attributes
estimator_src_instance of LinearRegression or Ridge

Fitted source estimator.

coef_numpy array

Coefficient of target linear estimator

intercept_float

Intercept of target linear estimator

ynumpy array

Output data.

src_indexiterable

indexes of source labeled data in X, y.

tgt_indexiterable

indexes of target unlabeled data in X, y.

fit_params_srcdict, optional (default=None)

Arguments given to the fit method of the source estimator (epochs, batch_size…). If None, fit_params_src = fit_params_tgt

Arguments given to the fit method of the target estimator (epochs, batch_size…).
